quiz.text: Which section of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949 defines and provides the clear cut definition of banking ?
options: Section 5(A)
Section 5(B)
Section 5(C)
Section 4(B)
Section 6(A)

quiz.text: India has a very rich history of banking, in the same regard, which of the following was the first bank to start its operation in India ?
options: The General Bank of India
Oudh Commercial Bank
Bank of Bombay
Bank of Hindustan
None of the above

quiz.text: During the British rule in India, which of the following bank was not termed as presidential bank ?
options: Bank of Bengal
Bank of Bombay
Bank of Gujarat
Bank of Madras
None of the above

quiz.text: Three Presidential Banks were later merged into one single bank in 1921, which was called the “Imperial Bank of India.” Later Imperial bank of India was merged into which of the following bank ?
options: Punjab National Bank
State Bank of India
Madras Bank of India
Union Bank of India
Reserve Bank of India

quiz.text: If we see the history of banking In India, Phase 3 of Banking history is tagged as  Liberalization Period which started in 1991 and runs up to the present day, Liberalization in Indian banking sector was begun since 1991, following the (________"X"________ )Report (December 1991)Identify X from the following options.
options: Nagarajan Committee
Praful Committee
Narasimham Committee
Gandhi Committee
RBI working Committee

quiz.text: Following it was the formation of State Bank of India in 1955 and there were 14 banks which were nationalized between the time duration of 1969 to 1991. These were the banks whose national deposits were more than what amount ?
options: 10 Crore
20 Crore
30 Crore
40 Crore
50 Crore

quiz.text: Nationalization is the process of taking privately controlled companies, industries, or private assets and putting them under the control of the government. The first phase of banking nationalization started in which year ?
options: 1960
1969
1975
1979
1869

quiz.text: After phase 2 of the banking nationalization, total how many banks were nationalized ?
options: 10
20
30
25
15

quiz.text: Identify the type of banking activity wherein the commercial banks give only short-term loans to industry, trade, and commerce. They specialize in short-term finance only
options: Pure Banking
Correspondent Banking
Group Banking
Mixed Banking
Relationship Banking

quiz.text: Identify the type of banking activity wherein bank may be concentrating only on the collection of deposits and lend or invest the money within a particular region or certain chosen activity like investing the funds only in Government Securities.
options: Relationship Banking
Narrow Banking
Pure Banking
Mixed Banking
Group Banking

quiz.text: Identify the type of banking activity wherein the banks deal with large customers and keep only large accounts. These are mainly corporate customer.
options: Universal Banking
Regional Banking
Wholesale Banking
Retail Banking
Private Banking

quiz.text: CORE banking is anywhere banking with the same bank be it any location. All this can be done without sending the cheque outstation for clearing the transaction. This saves on time and money for sending the cheque for clearing to another city. Banking software and network technology allow a bank to centralize its record keeping and allow access from any location. What does O stands in CORE banking
options: Operation
Online
Offline
Often
Output

quiz.text: In India, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) act as a Central Bank. The Reserve Bank of India started its operation on 1st April 1935. The powers of RBI are vested in Reserve Bank of India act ______ ?
options: Reserve Bank of India Act, 1930
Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934
Reserve Bank of India Act, 1944
Reserve Bank of India Act, 1949
Reserve Bank of India Act, 1935

quiz.text: A commercial bank is a kind of financial institution that carries all the operations related to deposit and withdrawal of money for the public, providing loans for investment, and other such activities. The two primary characteristics of a commercial bank are lending and borrowing. The Reserve Bank of India defines scheduled commercial banks in the 2nd Schedule of the RBI Act 1934. These are banks which have paid up capital and reserves above ______ lakh
options: 1 Lakhs
2 Lakhs
3 Lakhs
4 Lakhs
5 Lakhs

quiz.text: Regional Rural Banks are the Scheduled Commercial banks in India conducting banking activities for the rural regions at the state level. The first Regional Rural Bank (RRB) came into existence on Gandhi Jayanti in 1975 with the formation of a Prathama Grameen Bank. The RRBs have the legislative backing from the Regional Rural Banks Act 1976. What is the stake of State Government in Regional Rural Bank ?
options: 50%
35%
20%
12%
None of the above

quiz.text: A payments bank is like any other bank but operating on a smaller scale without involving any credit risk. What is minimum paid-up capital required to start payment bank business in India ?
options: 10 Crore
100 Crore
20 Crore
25 Crore
200 Crore

quiz.text: Small finance banks are a type of niche banks in India. Banks with a small finance bank license can provide basic banking service of acceptance of deposits and lending. What is the minimum capital required to start a small finance bank in India ?
options: 100 Crore
200 Crore
300 Crore
400 Crore
500 Crore

quiz.text: What is the maximum amount for which a payment bank can lend ?
options: 1 Lakh per customer only
2 Lakh per customer only
3 Lakh per customer only
4 Lakh per customer only
None of the above

quiz.text: The Reserve Bank of India was established on April 1, 1935, in accordance with the provisions of the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934. The Central Office of the Reserve Bank was initially established in which of the following city
options: Madras
Kolkata
Mumbai
Delhi
jaipur

quiz.text: Though originally privately owned, since nationalization in 1949, the Reserve Bank is fully owned by the Government of India. RBI was nationalized on 1 January 1949. The RBI has four zonal offices at Chennai, Delhi, Kolkata and Mumbai. How many members are there on board of directors of RBI
options: 20
21
22
23
25

quiz.text: Before 1950, the Reserve bank of India served as a central bank to which of the following two nations ?
options: Burma and Pakistan
Nepal and Bhutan
Burma and Nepal
Bhutan and Pakistan
Burma and Srilanka

quiz.text: Presently how many fully owned subsidiaries of RBI are there ?
options: 1
2
3
4
5

quiz.text: Which subsidiary of RBI is mandated to design, deploy and support IT-related services to all Banks and Financial Institutions in the country and to the Reserve Bank of India.
options: Deposit Insurance and Credit Guarantee Corporation of India (DICGC)
Bhartiya Reserve Bank Note Mudran Private Limited (BRBNMPL)
Reserve Bank Information Technology Private Limited (ReBIT)
Indian Financial Technology and Allied Services (IFTAS)
Reserve Bank Innovation Hub (RBIH)

quiz.text: The Reserve Bank of India has set up Reserve Bank Innovation Hub (RBIH) to promote innovation across the financial sector by leveraging on technology and creating an environment that would facilitate and foster innovation. RBIH is registered under which of the following acts ?
options: The Reserve Bank of India act, 1934
The Banking Regulation Act, 1949
The Companies Act, 2013
The cooperative Societies Act, 2002
None of the above

quiz.text: Deposit Insurance and Credit Guarantee Corporation (DICGC) came into existence on July 15, 1978. DICGC was established for providing insurance of deposits and guaranteeing of credit facilities. At present, DICGC ensures each depositor of a registered insured bank up to a maximum of _______ Lakh for all bank deposits, such as saving, fixed, current, recurring deposits
options: One lakh
Two  lakh
Three lakh
Five lakh
Four lakh

quiz.text: The primary objective of monetary policy is to maintain price stability while keeping in mind the objective of growth. Price stability is a necessary precondition to sustainable growth. In the same regard, The Central Government has decided to retain the inflation target of what percent, with a tolerance band of +/- 2 percentage points for the Monetary Policy Committee of the RBI for the coming five years up-to FY 2025-2026
options: 3%
4%
5%
6%
2%

quiz.text: Identify the Reserve Ratio, in which every financial institution must maintain a certain quantity of liquid assets with themselves at any point of time of their NDTL. Here, the deposits can be maintained in government securities, cash and gold assets.
options: Cash Reserve Ratio
Legal Reserve Ratio
Mandatory Reserve Ratio
Statutory Liquidity Ratio
None of the above

quiz.text: An open market operation is an instrument of monetary policy which involves buying or selling of government securities from or to the public and banks. In order increase the liquidity in the economy, the reserve bank will perform which of the following function under open market operation
options: Sell the Government Securities in money market
Sell the Government Securities in capital market
Sell the Government Securities in open market
Buy the Government Securities in open market
None of the above

quiz.text: Let's assume there is a very high inflation rate in the Indian economy, which of the following activities will not be performed by the RBI, if they want to reduce inflation ?
options: Increase the Repo Rate
Decrease the Repo Rate
Increase the Bank Rate
Increase the SLR and CRR
Selling of government securities in the open market

quiz.text: Which of the following measures will not be categorized as Selective Tools of Monetary Policy.
options: Fixing Margin Requirements
Consumer Credit Regulation
Selective Credit Control
Credit Rationing
Marginal Standing Facility (MSF

quiz.text: Identify the special type of lending facility which enables banks to borrow funds from RBI (Reserve Bank of India) in emergency situations when their liquidity absolutely dries up. This short-term borrowing scheme facilitates the scheduled banks to get funds from the central bank of India overnight in case of serious cash shortage by offering their approved government securities. Liquidity shortfalls are often faced by banks resulted from the financial gap created due to deposit and loan portfolio mismatch
options: Repo Facility
Reserve Repo Facility
Reverse Repo Facility
Marginal Standing Facility
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following market is not regulated by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) ?
options: Government securities market
Call money market
Foreign exchange market
Derivative Markets
All of the above markets are regulated by the Reserve Bank of India

quiz.text: The Liberalized Remittance Scheme (LRS) lays down the guidelines for outward remittances from India. It is part of the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) 1999. The Reserve Bank of India (RBI), under the LRS, what is the upper limit of remittance is per financial year
options: Rs. 2,50,000
Rs. 1,50,000
USD 2,50,000
USD 1,50,000
None of the above

quiz.text: The RBI has formulated a "Charter of Customer Rights" for banks based on global best practices in consumer protection. Which of the following is not the right mention in charter of customer rights
options: Right to Fair Treatment
Right to Transparency, Fair and Honest Dealing
Right to Privacy
Right to Suitability
Right to Ombudsman Facility

quiz.text: One Nation and One Ombudsman Scheme was announced by the RBI on 5th February 2021. There are dedicated ombudsman schemes devoted to consumer grievance redressal in banking, non-bank finance companies and digital transactions, respectively, are in operation from 22 ombudsman offices of the RBI located across the country. In line with the global initiatives on consumer protection, RBI has taken various initiatives to strengthen the Grievance Redress Mechanism of regulated entities. In the same regard, ‘Centralized Receipt and Processing Centre" has been set up in which city
options: Jaipur
Mumbai
Delhi
Hyderabad
None of the above

quiz.text: The Reserve Bank of India has released a national strategy for financial education to be implemented in the next five years for 2020-2025. NSFE, provides the 5 pillar approach which is commonly called a "5 C" approach, which of the following is not the 5 C mention in NSFE.
options: Content
Community
Communication
Capacity
Core

quiz.text: The Reserve Bank of India doesn't act as the regulator for which of the following financial institution ?
options: Commercial Banks
NBFCs
Urban Cooperative Banks
Rural Cooperative Banks
Payment and Small Finance Banks

quiz.text: Primary Agriculture Credit Societies (PACS) are outside the purview of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949 and hence not regulated by the Reserve Bank of India. Primary Cooperative Banks (PCBs), also referred to as ?
options: Urban Cooperative Banks
State Cooperative Banks
Rural Cooperative Banks
Country Cooperative Banks
National Cooperative Banks

quiz.text: Which of the following is the first co-operative bank to start its operation in India ?
options: Capital Co-operative Bank
Cinnaonya Co-operative Bank
Pratham Co-operative Bank
Angel Co-operative Bank
None of the above

quiz.text: Identify the Reserve Bank of India’s Medium-term Strategy Framework, in line with the evolving macroeconomic environment, to achieve excellence in the performance of RBI’s mandates and strengthening the trust of citizens and other institutions
options: Pratham 2022
Utkarsh 2022
Prakash 2022
Ujjwala 2022
Deepak 2022

quiz.text: The Reserve Bank of India decides to allot funds to predetermined priority sectors of the economy that may require credit and financial assistance, especially in cases where the lack of PSL (Priority Sectors Lendning) will lead to the heavy losses to the participants of that sector in some cases. How many sectors are there in PSL ?
options: 7
8
6
5
9

quiz.text: According to priority sector norms, scheduled commercial banks must give 40% of their loans (measured in terms of Adjusted Net Bank Credit or ANBC) to the identified priority sectors in accordance with the RBI regulations, in the same regard, Regional Rural Banks has total PSL target of ______% ?
options: 70%
50%
75%
80%
60%

quiz.text: According to priority sector norms, scheduled commercial banks must give 40% of their loans (measured in terms of Adjusted Net Bank Credit or ANBC) to the identified priority sectors in accordance with the RBI regulations. In the same regard, what is the PSL target for MSME ?
options: 8.5%
7.5%
6.5%
4.5%
5.5%

quiz.text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has planned the National Strategy for Financial Inclusion (NSFI) for the period 2019-2024. It is an ambitious strategy which aims to strengthen the ecosystem for various modes of digital financial services in all Tier-II to Tier VI centres to create the necessary infrastructure to move towards a less-cash society by March 2022. In the same regard, RBI aims to Increase outreach of banking outlets to provide banking access to every village within a _____ km radius ?
options: 2 Kms
3 Kms
5 Kms
6 Kms
None of the above

quiz.text: In consultation with the Government of India, RBI work towards maintaining confidence in the currency by constantly endeavoring to enhance integrity of banknotes through new design and security features. Mainly in India there are 4 printing presses, in the same regard, identify the place which do not host printing press.
options: Dewas in Madhya Pradesh
Nasik in Maharashtra
Noida in Uttar Pradesh
Mysore in Karnataka
Salboni in West Bengal

quiz.text: Coins are minted by the Government of India. The Reserve Bank is the agent of the Government for distribution, issue and handling of coins. Four mints are in operation, in the same regard, how many coin minting facilities are there in India ?
options: 1`
2
3
4
5

quiz.text: When the government declares money to be legal tender, which requires all people and firms within the country to accept it as a means of payment. Such type of money is known as ?
options: Commodity money
Fiat Money
Fiduciary Money
Commercial Bank Money
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect, with respect to NEFT
options: November 2005, The RBI introduced NEFT
The NEFT system provides for batch settlements at half-hourly intervals
The NEFT system provides real time fund transfer
NEFT has no limit - either minimum or maximum - on the amount of funds transferred
All of the above statements are incorrect

quiz.text: Identify the incorrect statement from the following statement, with respect to RTGS
options: RTGS is a funds transfer systems where transfer of money takes place on a "real time" and on "Non- gross" basis
Settlement in "real time" means payment transaction is not subjected to any waiting period.
This System of payment was introduced in in 2004
RTGS Settles all inter-bank payments and customer transactions above ₹2 lakh.
None of the above

quiz.text: Reserve Bank had introduced Magnetic Ink Character Recognition (MICR) technology for speeding up and bringing in efficiency in processing of cheques. The MICR code is a X-digit code. Identify X from the following option
options: 8
9
10
11
12

quiz.text: IFSC or Indian Financial System Code is an alpha-numeric code that uniquely identifies a bank-branch participating in the NEFT system. This is an Y-digit code. Identify Y from the following options
options: 10
11
12
13
14

quiz.text: IMPS is an innovative real time inter-bank electronic funds transfer system in India. Banks are allowed to set their own limit for IMPS. IMPS offers an inter-bank electronic fund transfer service through mobile phones. Unlike NEFT and RTGS, the service is available 24/7 throughout the year including bank holidays. What is the upper limit of transaction under IMPS ?
options: 2 Lakh
3 Lakh
4 Lakh
5 lakh
None of the above

quiz.text: BHIM (Bharat Interface for Money) is a mobile app developed by National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), based on the Unified Payment Interface (UPI). BHIM was launched in which year ?
options: 2017
2016
2015
2014
2018

quiz.text: Which of the following statement in incorrect regarding the features of NBFCs
options: NBFCs cannot accept demand deposits from public depositors or investors as it is not authorized by law
The minimum time period for which the public deposits can be taken by the company is 12 months, while the maximum tenure can be 24 months.
The Reserve Bank of India will not guarantee the repayment of any amount which is taken by the NBFCs.
NBFCs do not form the part of the Payment and settlement system
NBFCs cannot issue passbook to their customer

quiz.text: Non-banking financial company (NBFC) is a company which is registered under the companies act, 2013 and they also have to attain the license from RBI as explained in section 45-I of Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934. Identify the type of NBFC, which have a principle business of providing collateral free loans to small borrowers
options: Infrastructure Debt Fund (IDF)
NBFC – Factors
Infrastructure Finance Company (IFC)
Micro Finance Institutions (MFI)
Non-Operative Financial Holding Company (NOFHC)

quiz.text: Peer-to-Peer (P2P) Lending Platforms, Carries on the business of a P2P lending platform i.e. providing loan facilitation services to participants on the platform. What is minimum Net Owned Fund requirement for P2P lending platforms or  NBFCs ?
options: 1 Crore
2 Crore
3 Crore
4 Crore
5 Crore

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is correct
options: Fixed Deposits are also known as demand Deposits. Money is deposited for a fixed tenure. No withdrawal money during this period allowed.
Current Deposits are opened by businessmen. The account holders don't get an overdraft facility on this account.
Under recurring Deposits a certain sum of money is deposited in the bank at a regular interval. Money can be withdrawn only before the expiry of a certain period
NRE (Non-Resident External Rupees) Account, this account cannot be opened by Indian Resident
None of the above statement is correct

quiz.text: Identify the type of loan, wherein there is no fixed time to repay an amount it means it can be repaid at any time and such loan uses the floating rate of interest to charge an interest.
options: Secured Loan
Un-Secured Loan
Demand Loan
Subsidized Loan
Concessional loan

quiz.text: Identify the type of cheque, wherein no cash withdrawal can be done. The amount can only be transferred from the drawer’s account to the payee’s account. Any third party can visit the bank to submit the cheque.
options: Bearer Cheque
Order Cheque
Crossed Cheque
Account Payee Cheque
Stale Cheque

quiz.text: Identify the type of cheque, wherein drawer mentions a date prior to the current date on the cheque
options: Post Dated Cheque
Stale Cheque
Ante Dated Cheque
Mutilated Cheque
None of the above

quiz.text: An automated teller machine (ATM) is an electronic banking outlet that allows customers to complete basic transactions without the aid of a branch representative or teller. Identify the type of ATM, which deals with ecommerce transaction.
options: Offsite ATMs
White Label ATM
Yellow Label ATM
Orange Label ATM
Green Label ATM

quiz.text: Non-performing assets (NPA) refer to the classification of loans and advances in the books of a lender (usually banks) in which there is no payment of interest and principal have been received and are “past due.” Identify the type of asset, where in an asset remains NPA for period less than 12 month.
options: Standard Asset
Non-Performing Asset
Sub-Standard Asset
Doubtful Asset
Loss Asset

quiz.text: Prompt Corrective Action is a system of RBI under which it can initiate a corrective action in case of a bank which is found to be having low capital adequacy or high Non-performing Assets. These are called Trigger Points. How many trigger points are there in PCA ?
options: 1
2
3
4
5

quiz.text: Which of the following is not a pillar of mission Indra-dhanush ?
options: Transparency in Appointments
Introduction of Bank Boards Bureau
Optimum Capitalization
De-stressing
Reducing working hours and increasing wages

quiz.text: Identify the incorrect statement from below
options: Hypothecation is used for creating charge against the security of movable assets
Pledge is used when the lender (pledge) takes actual possession of assets (i.e. certificates, goods).
Mortgages  is used for creating charge against movable property
In pledge, the securities remain with the lender
None of the above

quiz.text: Currently, only 3 banks are categorized as D-SIB, they are State Bank of India, HDFC banks and ICICI bank. In order to be listed as a D-SIB, a bank needs to have assets that exceed ______ percent of the national GDP.
options: 1
3
2
5
4

quiz.text: As per Basel Norms, Minimum Capital Adequacy Ratio (CAR) which Banks should maintain a minimum capital adequacy requirement of 8% of risk assets. RBI has prescribed Minimum Capital Adequacy Ratio (CAR) of what percent ?
options: 8.5%
9%
9.5%
10.5%
None of the above

quiz.text: Hon’ble Prime Minister announced Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana as the National Mission on Financial Inclusion in his Independence Day address on 15th August 2014. The Basic Savings Bank Deposit Account or BSBDA is a Savings Account that does not have a minimum balance. How many withdrawal are allowed in BSBDA in a given month ?
options: 1
2
3
4
5

quiz.text: Permanent Account Number (PAN) is a code that acts as an identification for individuals, families and corporates (Indian and Foreign as well), especially those who pay Income Tax. PAN is a _______ digit alpha-numeric code
options: 14
15
10
11
12

quiz.text: Which of the followings statement is incorrect
options: National Housing Bank (NHB) was established in 1988
Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) was established in 1990,
Export and Import Bank of India (EXIM) was established in 1982
National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD) was established in 1982

quiz.text: Identify the incorrect statement from below
options: Founded in 1944, the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) was soon called the World Bank
The world bank compromises 5 other financial institutions
Asian Development Bank (ADB) was established in the year 1966, with head office in China
AIIB was formed in the year of December 2015. Its function is to support the building of infrastructure in the Asia-Pacific region.
The NDB is a multilateral financial institution established by the BRICS countries, namely, Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa

quiz.text: Identify the committee which was established to make changes in the monetary policy and and this committee was introduced flexible inflation targeting framework for RBI
options: Usha Thorat Committee
Vyas Committee
Siddique Committee
Urjit Patel Committee
None of the above

quiz.text: The Financial Action Task Force (FATF) is an intergovernmental organization founded in 1989 on the initiative of the G7 to develop policies to combat money laundering. Where is the head-quarter of FATF
options: Mumbai
London
Denmark
Paris
Iran

quiz.text: State bank of India, is the largest public sector bank of India, which of the following is the tagline for State bank of India ?
options: A Bank Of The Common Man
Pure Banking Nothing Else
The Banker To Every Indian
With You All The Way
All of the above

quiz.text: Recently, Allahabad Bank was merged with which of the following banks ?
options: Punjab National Bank (PNB)
Canara Bank
Union Bank of India
Indian Bank
None of the above

quiz.text: Which section of the RBI act 1934, grants the power to RBI to issue the currency
options: Section 21
Section 22
Section 23
Section 24
Section 25

quiz.text: A SWIFT code is an international bank code that identifies particular banks worldwide. It's also known as a Bank Identifier Code (BIC) and Bank uses SWIFT codes to send money to overseas banks. A SWIFT code consists of 8 or 11 characters. What does T stands for in SWIFT ?
options: Tele-network
Tele-communication
Tele-sales
Tele-Net
Tele-data

quiz.text: The call/notice/term money market facilitates lending and borrowing of funds between banks and entities like Primary Dealers. An institution which has surplus funds may lend them on an uncollateralized basis to an institution which is short of funds. When Borrowing/Lending is done for 2 to 14 days, its known as ?
options: Call money market
Notice money market
Term money market
Capital market
None of the above

quiz.text: Debt Recovery Tribunals were established to facilitate the debt recovery involving banks and other financial institutions with their customers like NPA. DRTs were set up after the passing of Recovery of Debts due to Banks and Financial Institutions Act (RDBBFI), 1993. For a case to be accept by DRT, the amount involved should be more than ?
options: 10 Lakhs
20 Lakhs
30 Lakhs
40 Lakhs
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is correct ?
options: ASBA stands Application Supported by Booked Amount
In banking parlance, BBB stands Bank Boards Branch
DICGC stands for Deposit Investment and Credit Guarantee Corporation
ELSS stands for Equity Linked Secure Scheme
None of the above statements are correct
